Emerald Elementary School
October 23, 2019 at 6:20 PM ·

UNITY DAY 2019 - Explorers wore a variety of shades of orange to show that our school stands together for kindness, acceptance and inclusion of all. We will not tolerate bullying at Emerald and if our students were to see it happen they learned not to be bystanders. There were daily informational announcements throughout the past week to teach what bullying really means (and what it doesn’t). The students made a paper chain with things written on the links that they could do to prevent bullying and symbolize our unity. The 4th/5th graders did some digital art to create anti-bullying posters. We also read and discussed our new banner about being THE NICE KID. We are very excited to have it hung in our building as a constant reminder.
